comment: Uses poorly recorded lectures to teach. Does not know how to effectively use the D2L online learning tool implemented by the university. This leads to a poorly organized online class that is hard to follow along with.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Three assignments, one mandatory lab, and one test at the end of the semester worth 50% of your grade and covering random things picked from throughout the semester. I knew databases and SQL going into this and still almost failed because of the final.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Took him for mobile software development. He's pretty difficult to understand but you get used to the accent. He's funny and helpful sometimes, but you really have to back him into a corner to get the help. Attendance isn't necessary. Just do every single lab and assignment and bonus labs and make sure they work. Easy A if you do everything in full

Didn't have much contact with him throughout the semester, but his recorded lectures were definitely very helpful. There was only one test (the final exam) and 3 assignments. Even though there isn't a lot of HW, this class sure does make you learn about databases. The final is a bit hard; definitely study the review docs and you should do fine.

Class was online. All the material was not up-to-date. So you have to just figure it out all by yourself. Grades are always A if you submitted all your work ontime. Very considerable for the students, that he reserved the text book in the library for the students to borrow. Best professor I have ever had!!

Professor Kai is a Great Professor, He kind of expects you to Read the Material before class so that you can be ahead of the game. He's very helpful if you don't understand something and he is willing  to go the extra mile for you. He cracks a lot of jokes to ease tensions in the class but thats expected 3 main assignments, Not many Test, But STUDY

Lectures make good use of the powerpoints and examples to explain how database design should be done. Sometimes he will misunderstand a student's question though. And yes, we only have 3 assignments and no comprehensive final, so the workload is low. One might want more assignments but the in-class scenario discussions is good enough for me.

Prof is not a great teacher. He seems to know how to do it but can't explain it to others. Test are not fun either. Only 2 in a semester and 3 assignments, no final. Bonus is available but I would suggest you avoid this guy. Test are difficult and lecture is worthless.

he's not helpful. He knows his stuff but can't teach it to others. Often times would ask the class if we understood the ppts because he didn't. Doesn't really answer questions and his tests have nothing to do with the material he covers in class. He does make up for his lack of teaching ability by giving bonuses worth over 10% of final grade.

This teacher knows stuff, but he has hard time to make me us understand the course. I really want to learn more about database but he is not what i really need to learn. trust me i have nothing against him, but he has a lot to learn about teaching skill. He read more than he can explain. He choose student who support him to look good. I grade him D
Good professor. Has a heavy accent sometimes. Very accomodating with tests and homework.
